full_dialogue: Turn 7 [Speaker_1]: The procedure is really simple and convenient. All you need to do is fill in this Loan Application form. Turn 8 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 9 [Speaker_1]: Of course, we'll need some documentation from you. Like your resident permit, proof of salary and your USD Deposit Certificate, to use as collateral.
response_1: Right... anything else?
response_2: Will you require any documentation?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Come in, please. Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Good afternoon. Have a seat, please. You are Mr. Sun?
response_1: Good afternoon, Mrs Smith.
response_2: Hello. I need to come in for an appointment.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Hello, Miss Wu, This is Dan Robson calling from OTC limited. I'd like to check my last order. When exactly was it sent out? Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Sure. No problem.
response_1: I can check that for you right now. Would you mind holding?
response_2: Let me check, if I have finished this, can you look it over with me?

full_dialogue: Turn 15 [Speaker_1]: All right, let's fix it at 450 pieces then. And for every additional 50 pianos sold, we'll give you 1 % higher commission. Turn 16 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 17 [Speaker_1]: We would like to make a specific mention of one more point. As our sole distributor, you will neither handle the same or similar products of other origins nor re-export our goods to any other area outside your own.
response_1: One %.
response_2: I suppose all the other terms remain unchanged.

full_dialogue: Turn 17 [Speaker_1]: Yeah, I'm very nauseous. It's mostly nausea and a fever. Turn 18 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 19 [Speaker_1]: Thanks, Ann. Talk to you this afternoon.
response_1: Well, I'll cancel your appointments for today. And I'll tell Mr. Morley.
response_2: Well, hang in there. Those have the kind of problems that usually take a few days to resolve. Don't worry, we'll talk again.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Hello? Ms. Patterson? This is Bill from Workmate calling. I'm just wondering if you had a chance to look over the estimate I sent for your gala dinner project next month... As I said in my email, we can help you with production according to your needs, but we will only be able to give insite management support services on a limited basis. Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Yes, I have several copies, but they're all different versions... The latest I have is version 12, is that current?
response_1: Oh, yes. I reviewed your estimate. But it seems like the project blueprint you sent with the estimate is not quite what we had in mind. Did you get a copy of the specs for this project?
response_2: Hello, Bill... Thank you so much for calling me back so gradually! How are things, Christ? Any brochures from work?

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Sorry, he is out. Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: Sorry, I am not sure. Can I take a message?
response_1: What time do you expect him back then?
response_2: Well, do you know if he is coming?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: I am sorry I am so late to work. Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I lost track of time.
response_1: What's the excuse this time?
response_2: What was the problem?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Welcome to IBA. What can I do for you today? Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: No problem. Could you let me have your card and the money to be deposited?
response_1: Hi. I want to pay the fine for the books.
response_2: I'd like to pay some money in using my card, please.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Hello, this is Mary from the Taipei new station, what can i do for you? Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Hi, Mr Wang, who do you wish to speak to?
response_1: Hi, could you please get a message for me?
response_2: Hello, Marry, this is Lin Wang, calling from network.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Oh great! This stupid computer froze again! That's the third time today! Hey Samuel, can you come take a look at my PC? It's acting again. It must have a virus or something. Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: But I'm quite careful when I'm browsing theinternet, I have no idea how I could have picked up a virus.
response_1: Just give me a second. I'll be right up. I ran a virus scan on your computer, and it turns out that you have a lot of infected files!
response_2: They wouldn't find anything. You could keep it paid, because you're very careful about these things.

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Thank you for your interest. The position is still available. Have you already sent your CV to us? Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: It is urgent for us to fill this position now and I would like to stress that English is a must because of the international contacts and most likely traveling abroad very soon. If all these is not problem for you, I recommend you to mention these in your cover letter and send it to me directly.
response_1: No, not yet. First, I want to check about the availability and see if you could give more information.
response_2: No, I haven't.

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I'm sorry, he is not here at the moment. He has gone to the International Business Center. Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: I'm not sure, he didn't say when he wound return. If you'd like.you can leave him a message until he is back to you until the moment it's free.
response_1: Do you know when he will be back?
response_2: When do you expect him back?

full_dialogue: Turn 13 [Speaker_1]: do you like working in teams with people from different departments? Turn 14 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 15 [Speaker_1]: do you like working in teams?
response_1: I like working with the people I work with and getting to know them and they get to know me.
response_2: yes, it helps everyone to understand what we're doing from different perspectives.

full_dialogue: Turn 7 [Speaker_1]: And when do you need to fill the vacancy, Mr. Parsons? Turn 8 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 9 [Speaker_1]: That sounds ideal.
response_1: I usually fill it with allowance. I don't want to draw any fumes in the room.
response_2: Yesterday! But no, we are hoping to start from the beginning of next month.

full_dialogue: Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: Is there some way I can get into contact with him? Turn 6 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 7 [Speaker_1]: Thanks. And could I have his e-mail, just in case I can't get him by phone?
response_1: Sure, his room number is lem-cellent3.
response_2: The best way to reach him is by cell phone. I'll give you his number.

full_dialogue: Turn 9 [Speaker_1]: Have you had any nursing experience? Turn 10 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 11 [Speaker_1]: How tall are you? What about your eyesight?
response_1: I used to work as a nurse at the hospital.
response_2: Yes, I have two years of nursing experience, and now I am working as a nurse in a hospital.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Excuse me sir. May I come in? Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I'm sorry, but my sister was ill, so I
response_1: Dang, glad your cut wasn't as bad as yours.
response_2: Mike, you're late again.

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: The company introduction, our mission, vision, various policies, insurances, pension plan, company ID, batch, telephone, e-mail set-up and training. Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: Yes, it is not easy.
response_1: Wow, that is quite a big machine.
response_2: Quite a lot. All them one afternoon?

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: How much do you need? Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: All right, can I have your passbook?
response_1: Three dollars.
response_2: Three thousand US dollars.

full_dialogue: Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: With our Personal Automobile Consumer Loan, the borrower can borrow up to 80 % of the purchase price. Turn 6 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 7 [Speaker_1]: That's great. You will need to make an initial down payment of 20 %, and then we can get going with this.
response_1: I want to get a new car. I would like to have the BMW.
response_2: That's good news. The car I'm interested in is priced at 120,000 RIB, but I think I can get a bit of discount on that. I can afford to put up around 40,000 RIB myself.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: What did you do at the office today? Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: What kind of things did you need to check?
response_1: I had a really busy day. I had to work a little overtime. In the morning an important client called to place a large order. I had to check some things with my colleagues before confirming the order.
response_2: I went to the office to check things for the Internet.

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: What do you need me for? Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: What kind of case do you have?
response_1: I need you for my court date.
response_2: I would like you to work on a case for me.

full_dialogue: Turn 7 [Speaker_1]: Yes, I can bring the outline when I come to the meeting. Turn 8 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 9 [Speaker_1]: I think that we should have just the sub-committee.
response_1: That's very commendable, but it seems that nothing is really brought to the discussion. Can you think of anything that you would like to bring to talk about?
response_2: Do you think that we should include the entire committee in the meeting or just our sub-committee?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Are you all right? Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: What's going on?
response_1: No, I'm not.
response_2: No.
